sense.name: (physics) One of a series of ridges, as of particles or liquid.
sense.examples: The wave moved over the surface of the water. Subatomic particles sometimes move in waves. The movement was shaped like a wave. The ocean was covered in waves.

sense.name: The movement of a certain phenomenon, similar to a physical undulation..
sense.examples: The troops advanced in waves. There was a sudden wave of buying before the market closed. A wave of emotion swept over him.

sense.name: The act of signaling by a movement of the hand.
sense.examples: She gave him a quick wave before leaving. I gave her a wave as I entered the car.

sense.name: A hairdo that creates undulations in the hair.
sense.examples: The wave was once a salon staple. She sported a wave and shoulder pads.

sense.name: A persistent and widespread weather condition.
sense.examples: There was a heat wave across the South. We are caught in a wave of tropical heat.

sense.name: A member of the women's reserve of the United States Navy.
sense.examples: She was a Wave in the early years of the war.
